classtemplate.name: PassThroughStageQueue
classtemplate.brief: A pass-through stage is a stage that does not queue a message
classtemplate.doc:
but processes it immediately upon dispatch.
This can be used to easily combine stages into aggregate stages without having to rework the application logic.
This is convenient while experimenting with work breakout during development and performance testing.
I hope to eventually provide tools for doing pass-through stage combination at compile time (without requiring client code to introduce virtual function calls for queue functionality) but that is a long way off I think.

method.name: push
method.brief: called in the same thread as the stage invoking dispatch to
method.doc: the stage owning this queue (the previous stage in the stage graph).
